byline.contributor: David W. Chen contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Rep Tom MacArthur, Republican of New Jersey, calls for congressional investigation into management of flood insurance program by Federal Emergency Management Agency, accusing agency of preventing thousands of Hurricane Sandy victims from receiving payments; MacArthur reveals that whistle-blowers have shown process used to re-examine insurance claims from storm has been marred by fraud.

headline.print_headline: New Jersey Congressman Wants FEMA Investigated
headline.main: New Jersey Representative, Citing Fraud, Calls on Congress to Investigate FEMA

snippet: Representative Tom MacArthur said the agency’s process to re-examine insurance claims from Hurricane Sandy, following allegations of fraud, was itself plagued by fraud.
lead_paragraph: Representative Tom MacArthur said the agency’s process to re-examine insurance claims from Hurricane Sandy, following allegations of fraud, was itself plagued by fraud.
